Returns a dataframe of metadata for all arrays that meet the filter applied. Note that this is a paginable API but default params return all results on one call, even hundreds of them. As currently implemented, pagination information is not returned from this function. The public shared arguments may not both be true.

Source: R/manual_layer_array.R
list_arrays.Rd

Returns a dataframe of metadata for all arrays that meet the filter applied. Note that this is a paginable API but default params return all results on one call, even hundreds of them. As currently implemented, pagination information is not returned from this function. The public shared arguments may not both be true.

list_arrays(
  public = FALSE,
  shared = FALSE,
  page = NULL,
  per.page = NULL,
  search = NULL,
  namespace = NULL,
  orderby = NULL,
  permissions = NULL,
  tag = NULL,
  exclude.tag = NULL,
  file.type = NULL,
  exclude.file.type = NULL,
  file.property = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

public

logical TRUE means list public arrays
shared

logical TRUE means list shared arrays. If public and shared are both false then arrays owned by you are listed.
page

integer
per.page

integer
search

character
namespace

character
orderby

character
permissions

character
tag

list( character )
exclude.tag

list( character )
file.type

list( character )
exclude.file.type

list( character )
file.property

list( character )

Value

Dataframe of metadata for all arrays in your account that meet the filter applied.
